etymology.description: 搅(攪) (jiǎo, "stir") and 拌(拌) (bàn, "mix") together mean the action of stirring and mixing substances. This combination logically represents the process of actively blending materials, often for cooking or industrial purposes.
etymology.interpretation: 搅(攪) (jiǎo, "stir") involves a motion of agitation, while 拌(拌) (bàn, "mix") refers to combining substances. Used together, they succinctly describe the common action in cooking or mixing substances by stirring.

examples.chinese: 他用木棒搅拌面糊(他用木棒攪拌麵糊)。
examples.english: He stirs the batter with a wooden stick.

examples.chinese: 妈妈在厨房搅拌汤汁(媽媽在廚房攪拌湯汁)，细心调配调料(細心調配調料)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā zài chúfáng jiǎobàn tāngzhī, xìxīn tiáopèi tiáoliào.
examples.english: Mom stirs the soup in the kitchen, carefully mixing the seasonings.

examples.chinese: 厨师搅拌酱汁时(廚師攪拌醬汁時)，火候掌握得恰到好处(火候掌握得恰到好處)。
examples.pinyin: Chúshī jiǎobàn jiàngzhī shí, huǒhòu zhǎngwò dé qià dào hǎochù.
examples.english: The chef stirs the sauce, perfectly controlling the heat.
